sentences.sContent: He’s one of the greatest living composers.
sentences.sCn: 他是仍然健在的最伟大的作曲家之一。

sentences.sContent: The sun affects all living things (= people, animals, and plants ).
sentences.sCn: 太阳与一切生物息息相关。
活语言，仍在使用的语言

sentences.sContent: It’s not a great job, but it’s a living.
sentences.sCn: 这不是什么了不起的工作，不过是一种生计。

sentences.sContent: ...At the top of most hills and mountains are trails living back to civilizations...
...It was like living in an age you could never have imagined...
...The author thinks her friend made a rational decision in choosing a more hospitable place over an apparently elegant assisted living home...
...It is really difficult to tell if assisted living is better than a nursing home...
...At first the researchers of the most recent study found residents in assisted living facilities gave higher scores on social interaction...
...The report warns that 200 million poor workers are at risk of joining the ranks of people living on less than 2 dollars per day in the past three years...
...assisted living residents did paint the most positive picture...
...did you ever think that you would find yourself living and working in the western world...
...Whether we learn about these differences by reading a book or by living abroad...
...Millennials may be the first　generation to have a lower standard of living than their parents...

synos.tran: 活的；现存的；活跃的；逼真的

phrases.pCn: [生]活化石；[口]落后于时代的人

words.tran: 活的；生动的；实况转播的；精力充沛的
活泼的；生动的；真实的；生气勃勃的
适于居住的；生活过得有价值的

trans.tranOther: the way that you earn money or the money that you earn
